questionText: Which language is used to create the structure of a web page?
reason: HTML defines the structure and content of a web page.

questionText: Which language is used to style web pages?
reason: CSS is used to define the presentation (look and formatting) of web pages.

questionText: Which language is used to make web pages interactive?
reason: JavaScript allows dynamic content and interaction on web pages.

questionText: Which HTML topic is used to insert an image?
reason: The topic embeds images in an HTML document.

questionText: Which HTML topic creates a hyperlink?
reason: The <a> topic is used to create hyperlinks.

questionText: Which attribute specifies the URL of a hyperlink?
reason: The href attribute defines the URL in a hyperlink.

questionText: Which topic is used to create an unordered list?
reason: <ul> defines an unordered list.

questionText: Which topic is used to create an ordered list?
reason: <ol> defines an ordered list.

questionText: Which topic defines a table row?
reason: <tr> defines a row in a table.

questionText: Which topic defines a table header cell?
reason: <th> is used for table header cells.

questionText: Which CSS property changes the text color?
reason: The 'color' property in CSS sets text color.

questionText: Which CSS property changes the background color?
reason: 'background-color' sets the element's background.

questionText: Which CSS property sets the font size?
reason: 'font-size' controls text size.

questionText: Which CSS property sets the spacing between letters?
reason: 'letter-spacing' adjusts space between letters.

questionText: Which CSS property sets the vertical space between lines of text?
reason: 'line-height' controls spacing between lines.

questionText: Which HTML element contains metadata about a page?
reason: <head> contains metadata and links.

questionText: Which HTML element contains the visible page content?
reason: <body> contains what users see.

questionText: Which JavaScript function prints to the browser console?
reason: console.log() prints to the browser console.

questionText: Which HTML topic embeds JavaScript?
reason: <script> embeds or links JavaScript.

questionText: Which HTML topic embeds internal CSS?
reason: <style> defines internal CSS.

questionText: Which attribute sets inline CSS for an element?
reason: The 'style' attribute sets inline CSS.

questionText: Which attribute gives a unique identifier to an element?
reason: The 'id' must be unique in a document.

questionText: Which attribute applies a CSS class to an element?
reason: The 'class' attribute groups elements.

questionText: Which HTTP method retrieves data from a server?
reason: GET fetches data without modifying it.

questionText: Which HTTP method sends data to a server?
reason: POST requests submit data to the server.

questionText: Which HTML attribute specifies the server URL for a form?
reason: The 'action' attribute sets the form submit URL.

questionText: Which HTML form attribute specifies the HTTP method?
reason: The 'method' attribute sets GET or POST.

questionText: Which input type creates a text box?
reason: type='text' creates a text input.

questionText: Which input type masks the text entered by the user?
reason: type='password' hides typed characters.

questionText: Which HTML element defines a dropdown list?
reason: <select> creates a dropdown list of options.

questionText: Which HTML element is used to create a checkbox?
reason: A checkbox is created using <input type='checkbox'>.

questionText: Which HTML element is used to create a radio button?
reason: A radio button is created using <input type='radio'>.

questionText: Which JavaScript event occurs when a user clicks on an element?
reason: The 'onclick' event triggers when the user clicks on an element.

questionText: Which JavaScript function displays an alert dialog?
reason: alert() shows a message in a dialog box.

questionText: Which method is used to select an element by its ID in JavaScript?
reason: getElementById() returns the element with the specified ID.

questionText: Which method is used to add a class to an HTML element using JavaScript?
reason: classList.add() adds one or more classes to an element.

questionText: Which HTML topic is used to create a numbered list?
reason: <ol> creates an ordered (numbered) list.

questionText: Which HTML topic is used to create a bulleted list?
reason: <ul> creates an unordered (bulleted) list.

questionText: Which attribute specifies the destination URL of a link?
reason: The href attribute sets the destination of a hyperlink.

questionText: Which CSS property sets the margin outside an element?
reason: The 'margin' property sets the space outside the element's border.

questionText: Which CSS property sets the padding inside an element?
reason: Padding sets the space between content and border.

questionText: Which CSS property changes the font family of text?
reason: 'font-family' sets the font of text.

questionText: Which CSS property sets the width of an element?
reason: 'width' sets the horizontal size of an element.

questionText: Which CSS property sets the height of an element?
reason: 'height' sets the vertical size of an element.

questionText: Which HTML topic is used to create a text input field?
reason: A text input is created using <input type='text'>.

questionText: Which HTML topic is used to create a multi-line text area?
reason: <textarea> allows multi-line input.

questionText: Which HTML topic is used to create a dropdown list?
reason: <select> creates a dropdown list.

questionText: Which HTML topic is used to define a table cell?
reason: <td> defines a cell in a table row.

questionText: Which HTML topic defines a table header row?
reason: <thead> defines the table header section.

questionText: Which HTML topic defines a table footer row?
reason: <tfoot> defines the footer of a table.

questionText: Which JavaScript keyword declares a variable?
reason: 'var' is used to declare variables in JavaScript.

questionText: Which JavaScript keyword declares a block-scoped variable?
reason: 'let' declares variables scoped to the block.

questionText: Which JavaScript keyword declares a constant?
reason: 'const' declares a variable whose value cannot change.

questionText: Which JavaScript method gets the value of an input field?
reason: .value gets or sets the value of an input element.

questionText: Which JavaScript method changes the content of an HTML element?
reason: innerHTML allows you to get or set the HTML content of an element.

questionText: Which method is used to attach an event handler in JavaScript?
reason: addEventListener() attaches an event to an element.

questionText: Which JavaScript function converts a string to a number?
reason: parseInt() converts a string to an integer.

questionText: Which JavaScript function converts a number to a string?
reason: toString() converts a number to a string.

questionText: Which operator checks equality of value and type in JavaScript?
reason: === checks both value and type.

questionText: Which JavaScript keyword stops a loop prematurely?
reason: 'break' exits the current loop immediately.

questionText: Which HTML element is used to display a paragraph?
reason: defines a paragraph of text.

questionText: Which HTML element is used to display a heading?
reason: <h1> to <h6> define headings from largest to smallest.

questionText: Which HTML topic is used for a horizontal line?
reason: <hr> creates a horizontal rule (line).

questionText: Which HTML topic is used for a line break?
reason: inserts a line break.

questionText: Which CSS property changes text alignment?
reason: text-align aligns text horizontally inside an element.

questionText: Which CSS property makes text bold?
reason: font-weight: bold makes text bold.

questionText: Which CSS property makes text italic?
reason: font-style: italic makes text italic.

questionText: Which CSS property sets the border width?
reason: border-width sets the thickness of the border.

questionText: Which CSS property sets the border color?
reason: border-color sets the color of an element's border.

questionText: Which CSS property sets the background image?
reason: background-image sets an image as the element's background.

questionText: Which HTML element represents the main content of a page?
reason: <main> represents the primary content of the page.

questionText: Which HTML element represents a section in a page?
reason: <section> defines a thematic section in a page.

questionText: Which HTML element represents an article?
reason: <article> represents a self-contained composition.

questionText: Which HTML element represents navigation links?
reason: <nav> contains primary navigation links.

questionText: Which HTML element is used to display emphasized text?
reason: <em> emphasizes text, usually italic.

questionText: Which HTML element is used to display important text?
reason: <strong> indicates strong importance, usually bold.

questionText: Which CSS unit represents relative font size based on parent?
reason: 1em equals the font size of the parent element.

questionText: Which CSS unit represents absolute pixels?
reason: px sets size in absolute pixels.

questionText: Which HTML topic is used to embed a video?
reason: <video> embeds video content in a page.

questionText: Which HTML topic is used to embed audio?
reason: <audio> embeds audio content in a page.

questionText: Which HTML attribute provides alternative text for images?
reason: alt describes the image for accessibility and SEO.

questionText: Which HTML attribute sets a tooltip when hovering over an element?
reason: The 'title' attribute shows a tooltip on hover.

questionText: Which CSS property controls element visibility?
reason: visibility can hide or show elements without affecting layout.

questionText: Which CSS property completely removes an element from the layout?
reason: display: none removes the element from the layout entirely.

questionText: Which HTML element is used to create a button?
reason: <button> creates a clickable button element.

questionText: Which input type creates a submit button?
reason: <input type='submit'> sends the form data.

questionText: Which CSS pseudo-class applies style when the mouse is over an element?
reason: :hover applies styles when the mouse pointer is over an element.

questionText: Which HTML attribute specifies the type of an input element?
reason: The 'type' attribute defines the input element type.

questionText: Which HTML attribute defines the placeholder text in input?
reason: The 'placeholder' attribute shows hint text inside an input field.

questionText: Which HTML topic creates a form?
reason: <form> is used to create a form for user input.

questionText: Which JavaScript method opens a new browser window?
reason: window.open() opens a new browser window or tab.

questionText: Which JavaScript method closes the current window?
reason: window.close() closes the current browser window.

questionText: Which HTML element defines an ordered list?
reason: <ol> creates a numbered list.

questionText: Which HTML element defines an unordered list?
reason: <ul> creates a bulleted list.

questionText: Which HTML element defines a list item?
reason: <li> defines an item in a list.

questionText: Which HTML topic defines a definition list?
reason: <dl> defines a definition list.

questionText: Which HTML topic defines a term in a definition list?
reason: <dt> defines a term in a definition list.

questionText: Which HTML topic defines a description in a definition list?
reason: <dd> defines a description for a term.

questionText: Which JavaScript method returns the length of a string?
reason: .length returns the number of characters in a string.

questionText: Which JavaScript method converts JSON text into an object?
reason: JSON.parse() converts a JSON string into a JavaScript object.
